channel.description: Beyond 50 Radio is a weekly and educational talk show for Baby Boomers for the Pacific Northwest. Based in Portland, Oregon, it has been on-the-air since 2004. Hosted by Daniel Davis, he interviews best-selling authors, celebrities, experts and visionary leaders from all over the Pacific Northwest. You can also hear from our local sponsors who like to educate so that you can be a savvier consumer. For more, visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our e-newsletter. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:author: Daniel Davis
channel.itunes:subtitle: Beyond 50

item.title: Meet Shri Babaji and Experience His Supreme Peace
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Shri Babaji is a Self-Realized Yogi who is established in the Supreme Peace. His full name is Shri Shiva Rudra Balayogi. He carries on the Mission of His Divine Guru, Shri Shri Shri Shivabalayogi. Shri Babaji will answer many spiritual questions. He is a Knower of the Truth. This is an extraordinary happening. Babaji is the embodiment of Love, Compassion and Humility. Here, Babaji is interviewed by Laurie Day, holistic psychotherapist. Laurie will be asking such questions as: "Is it possible to change our future and the future of humanity?" "Will You describe the Now, the Present Moment? What is the experience of being fully Present...Here and Now?" "Will You clarify Detachment and Non Doership? How do they relate to real Love, Unconditional Love?" "Is spending so much time on cell phones and computers good for children?" "What are the qualities of a spiritually Mature person?" "How do we pray to the Divine for a loved one who has departed?" "You have said, 'Letting Go is the biggest leap a human can take in crossing the illusion of this universe.' Will You please share more about this?" "Is it guaranteed that we will all go back to God?"

item.title: EPISODE 278 - Transition to the Golden Age in 2032
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Diana Cooper from England. She will talk about climatic shifts globally that includes a time frame for the massive transition that is anticipated to last until Earth moves into the fifth dimensional frequency in 2032. She'll help you to attune yourself to the spiritual forces that are coming into the planet. According to her, we are on the brink of the most exciting time for the planet and the most important opportunity for spiritual growth there has ever been. Millions of people will be "waking up" over hte next five to ten years. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 277 - Dr. Will Novak: Healthy Pet Care
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Pet Care" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Will Novak, a veterinarian and CEO of Hannah, The Pet Society. He'll educate about pet health, from the best pet food to feed to your perfect pet match. You'll also learn about Hannah, a new and innovative company that not only help you find a great pet through their proprietary pet matching software, but also provides total life care TLC delivered to your home for one low, monthly fee. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 276 - Sensory Learning: Using Light, Sound and Motion
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Mary Bolles. She is the founder of the Sensory Learning Center in Colorado. You'll learn about her innovative method of integrating the use of light, sound and motion for sensory perception problems that can result in learning disabilities. Bolles is an expert in Ocular Light Therapy to improve sensory processing in the brain stem area. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 275 - The Unstoppable Golfer: Trusting Your Mind & Your Short Game
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sports" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Bob Rotella. He is a world renowned golf psychologist to the game's top players. He'll talk about the mind's role in the most difficult aspect of golfing - the short game. Long drives may garner applause, but whether a golfer wants to win the Masters or just five bucks from a friend on Saturday morning, it's the little shots that make the difference. Yet many players either fail to recognize or choose to ignore the importance of the short game. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 274 - Earth Ways: Healing Medicine for the Soul
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Earth Day" talks, listen to an interview with Sonja Grace. She'll discuss about the practice of creating ritual through prayer, meditation and insights as a means to reconnect and give back to the Earth - acknowledging that she is alive and is a living being. As will all ceremonies, it is important that your intention is clear, for that is truly what makes any ceremony powerful. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Carla Hannaford. She'll explain about how we all are as vibrational fields in a sea of vibrational fields. item.title: EPISODE 272 - Flesh Off the Bone: Archetypal Dreaming
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of March as Women's History Month, listen to a "Personal Growth" talk with master dream teachers and therapists Christa Lancaster and Marc Bregman. They will discuss the powerful message coming to many of us, individually and collectively, in our dreams - that the essence of the sould, the one within us who knows divine union and unconditional love, often comes in our dreams as a girl. She carries the firce power, vulnerability, sunsuality and love that are our birthright. this archetypal girl brings her elemental, life changing potency to men and women alike, always offering the possibility for true transformation. Find out what the emergence of the feminine soul means to us all and the world today. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talk, listen to an interview with Master Roger Givens. He will explain about developing your Soul Healing Power. The secret to healing is to heal the soul first; then healing of the mind and body will follow. item.title: EPISODE 270 - Social Networks & The Death of Privacy
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Legal" talks, listen to an interview with Lori Andrews. She is a legal pioneer in the areas of modern ethics and privacy. She has written a much-overdue Social Network Constitution which extends our basic rights to this wild, new frontier. She'll provide information we all need to know to arm ourselves from online abusers, like how to remove personal data from aggregator sites. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 269 - Eat Vegan on $4 a Day
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Ellen Jaffe Jones. She will talk about vegan recipes that can be combined to get a per-serving cost of $4 per day - less than an average meal at a fast-food outlet. You can also learn to adapt your favorite recipe, cook with beans and grains, and use bulk buying to get big savings. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 268 - The Next Bold Step
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Kathryn Tull. She can help you to overcome the feeling of "I don't matter" or feeling stuck inside and can't move forward. Tull offers insights and a roadmap to having the life you want and deserve. Self-value lies at the very root of all your thoughts about yourself. When your deepest sense of self-value is secretly shaken, it will show up in many areas of your life. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 267 - Naked in the Nursing Home: Paying for Long Term Care
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Harold Lustig. He will talk about how to pay for long term care (LTC), even if you have little or no savings. Did you know that if you run out of money while in a long-term care facility, they can repossess your funeral plot? Or that people in LTC who are far from their adult children have shorter life spans than those with children nearby? Another little known fact is that there are more than 40-percent of people in LTC who are under age 65 - which means it's really younger, healthier people who need to learn about and plan for LTC, not just seniors. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 265 - Body Worlds & The Brain: Attention & Distraction
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical" talks, listen to an interview with Andrew McCollough, a researcher in the Department of Neurology at OHSU. He is an expert in the realm of visual cognition, specifically how attention is brought to bear in distracting or crowded environments. He is currently investigating the effect of meditation training on working memory and attention. You'll learn how attention is measured and studied; where attention is located in the brain; how to better control attention; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 264 - Futurist Visions on the Next 5 - 15 Years
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Emerging Trends" talks, listen to an interview with David Pearce Snyder. He is a popular futurist and contributing editor of "Futurist" magazine. Snyder has an encyclopedic knowledge from compiling a multi-million item database of trends and projections. He uses this database to create detailed scenarios - "instant pre-plays" of the most probably combinations of economic, technologic and social realities that specific industries, institutions, individual communities or nations are likely to encounter in the next 5 - 15 years.

item.title: EPISODE 263 - Neurofeedback: Resolving Anxiety, Depression & ADD
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Noel Thomas. She will explain about Neurofeedback (also known as EEG biofeedback) that is a non-invasive and scientifically proven therapy that trains the brain and central nervous system to function more efficiently and strengthen its own neurological connections. Once the brain has learned how to better self-regulate, the changes are generally maintained for life. Neurofeedback is a high tech brainwave biofeedback. It helps to optimize the brain's bio-electrical activity by improving neural communication and self-regulation. In the process, mood, behavior, attention and motivation improve and anxiety is reduced or resolved. It is a proven therapy for addressing many mental and emotional issues without the use of medication. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 262 - Mary Chestnut's Illustrated (Civil War) Diary
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Historical" talks, listen to an interview with Martha M. Daniels about the two-volume books called "Mary Chestnut's Illustrated Diary." It was chosen by the "Wall Street Journal" as one of the five most important diaries to come out of the Civil War. Thought to be lost or stolen since the 1930s, the albums were only discovered in 2007. It's an astonishing historical treasure. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 261 - Cavalia: An Equestrian & Performing Arts Spectacle
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Entertainment" talks, listen to an interview with Alain Gauthier, the Artistic Director of the show, "Cavalia" that is a fresh mix of equestrian and performing arts, multimedia and special effects. In a fairy tale setting filled with poetry and emotion, the show innovatively integrates acrobatics, dance, aerial stunts, live music and equestrian arts. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 260 - Salt, Fire & Time
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Cooking" talks, listen to an interview with Tressa Yellig, owner of Salt, Fire & Time in Oregon. She will talk about going back to ancient wisdom that allowed our food to be our medicine and gave people the power to heal themselves seasonally with what is available. One of her favorite traditional foods is a nourishing tonic of Bone Broth that takes 24-hours to make. It was a delicious "cure all" in traditional households. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 258 - Dr. Lynne Zimmerman: Heal Yourself
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Lynn Zimmerman. She'll explain that through simple exercises, you can "remap" the circuitry in your brain to heal conditions such as chronic pain, depression, cancer, and more. You'll understand the cutting-edge science behind the brain's ability to reconfigure its own electrochemical format to apply the power of quantum physics and neuroplasticity toward your own healing. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 257 - Awakening the Dreamer, Changing the Dream
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Green & Sustainable" talks, listen to an interview with Paul Spindel of the Earth Wisdom Alliance in Portland, Oregon. He will explain about their organization's mission and symposiums to awaken the dreamer (within us) and change the dream from our current nightmares to a more sustainable, just and fulfilling world. Their efforts are based on a call to action request from the Achuar, an indigenous people of the Amazon Basin who offer much wisdom about living in harmony with the natural world and with one another. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 256 - The New Kids: Big Dreams at High School for Immigrants
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Education" talks, listen to an interview with Brooke Hauser. She will talk about two pressing issues in American: education and immigration to offer an alternative to a lot of recent chatter on these topics by telling a positive story on both fronts. She spent about a year chronicling the lives of recently arrived immigrants from around the world starting school at Brooklyn's International High School at Prospect Heights. Many of them overcame unimaginable difficulties to reach the United States. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 255 - Suburban Permaculture
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Green & Sustainable" talks, listen to an interview with Jan Spencer. He gave his quarter acre, suburban property in Eugene, Oregon an "extreme" makeover, based on a permaculture model of sustainability. His grass is gone and replaced by edible landscaping all over; solar installed, plants grown vertically, about 6,500 gallons of rainwater is stored in 3 tanks, and his home has served as a community resource. He'll show you how to transform your suburban home to also affect the neighborhood, communities and culture. Interview co-hosted by Daniel Davis and college intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 254 - Queen of the Sun: What are the Bees Telling Us?
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Green & Sustainable" talks, listen to an interview with Taggart Siegel. He is the filmmaker of the documentary, "Queen of the Sun" that is about the effort to pollinate awareness about the declining, global bee population called colony collapse. As Carlo Petrini explains in the film, "If we kill all the bees, there will be no agriculture. I repeat, no agriculture. Bees are the pollinators that guarantee fruit growth and survival." The emphasis in the film is the biodynamic and organic communities that have deep and profound insights into the long-term issues that have brought about the recent collapse. It's all about bee survival and our own. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 248 - Heating Your Space with Far Infrared Heating Technology
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Green Living" talks, listen to an interview with Tom Wiseman of BioSmart Solutions (www.biosmartsolutions.com). He will explain about his company's advanced, new technology that can heat a home more efficiently than traditional central heating furnaces that tend to dry out the air and use oxygen. Learn about far-infrared heating that uses a patented, far-infrared heating technology to give soft, comfortable and therapeutic far-infrared heat and save you more money on your heating bills. item.title: EPISODE 246 - Kenneth Little Hawk: The Art of Storytelling
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: While everyone may have a good story, not everyone knows how to tell a good story. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Kenneth Little Hawk. He has spent a lifetime telling stories to millions across the world. He will share his remarkable skills with all those wishing to learn the art of the storyteller and the ancient skill of truly listening. To his Mi'Kmaq tribe, the wisdom of the story is found in the wind, the streams, the clouds and the trees, where the animls, birds and fish in the sea. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 245 - Project Happiness
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Randy Taran. She will talk about her film of four teen from Santa Cruz, CA. who face obstacles on their road to happiness: loss, alienation and the everyday challenges of teens passing into adulthood. Through the eyes of high school seniors in California, Nigeria and Dharamsala, they explore what happiness means to them. After a year together, they end their journey together with a talk about happiness with the Dalai Lama. Interview hosted by intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Harvey Z. Warren. He will help you to build critical skills to honestly assess your financial situation. You'll learn the truth about bankruptcy. There are plenty of resources you need to become debt-free. "Responsible Debt Relief" is really your best option. Warren has helped thousands of families find relief from crippling debt. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 241 - Helena de Crespo: Building a Theatre in Cambodia
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Inspirational" talks, listen to an interview with Helena de Crespo from Portland, Oregon. She is a renowned theater and television actress. In her travels, she has met with many performing artists, sometimes having the good fortune to work along side them. While in northwest Cambodia, she encountered the Reasmey Angkor Bassac Theatre Troupe and has made their survival, both as artists and human beings, her special cause. After acquiring funding, the Company is now in the process of building their own permanent theatre site that can preserve their culture and revive the economy to combat disease, land mines and child trafficking - the scourges of the area. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 240 - Bandwith, A Novel
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Technology" talks, listen to an interview with Angus Morrison. He is the author of "Bandwidth" that is fictional story based on the exploits of Hayden Campbell - a former CIA agent turned speech writer working for the 6th richest man in the world, Aaron Cannondale. Bandwidth captures the two dominant threads of the first decade of the 21st century - greed and terrorism. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

He is the author of "Bandwidth" that is fictional story based on the exploits of Hayden Campbell - a former CIA agent turned speech writer working for the 6th richest man in the world, Aaron Cannondale. Bandwidth captures the two dominant threads of the first decade of the 21st century - greed and terrorism. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 239 - You Can Break Free Fast: 3 Steps to Attract the Life You Love
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Caryl Westmore. She will explain about letting go of your inner blocks using a break-free-aha method to delete negative beliefs jamming your success system to attract money, love, health and happiness. It is based on a wonderful tool called EFT (Emotion Freedom Technique) - tapping on acupuncture points to affect the emotional brain (subconscious) and energy field. You'll also learn about her own dramatic life story from broken and penniless to living a dream life today. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Madeleine Walker, an animal communicator from Great Britain. She has traveled the world on a spiritual journey across several continents in search of wisdom from many exotic animals. item.title: EPISODE 236 - Cathartic Style Breathing
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Jackie Miller. She is a Cathartic Breathwork practitioner - one of only a few in the world. Cathartic Breathwork is an advanced breathing technique that uses the power of the breath for deep self-healing. In a session, breath energy quickly accumulates, cleansing and opening the energy body. Patterns of holding and tension, suppressed emotions and blocked energies tend to release and dissipate. Co-hosting the show is both Daniel Davis and intern, Devin DeCuna. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 233 - Bruce Lipton: The Biology of Belief & Spontaneous Evolution
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Bruce Lipton. He is a cell biologist, bestselling author and international leader in bridging science and spirit. His findings challenged the traditional, scientific view that life is controlled by the genes, which had lead to a new field of study called the Science of Epigentics. Joining the conversation is Rita Soman, a PSYCH-K practitioner from Troutdale, Oregon. She offers a unique way of embedding empowering beliefs into the subconscious that can be done in minutes. Her specialty is using PSYCH-K to break addictions. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 229 - Labyrinth: The Soul's Journey
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Jodi Lorimer. Find out about the Labyrinth in the Paleolithic. The first modern humans in Paleolithic Europe painted the labyrinth journey to the Otherworld on the walls of deep caves (in photo above) over 32,000 years ago. Ancient shamans mapped the route of the labyrinth revealing the complex minds and spirit of a sophisticated people. To understand the significance of this mythological symbol requires that we dig into the very core of human experience and tread the paradoxical paths of belief and biology, history and myth, and discover where they cross over into transcendence, at the Center. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: Taming Your Outer Child
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Susan Anderson. She is a nationally renowned expert on abandonment recovery. She's back on our program to explain about the Outer Child - the source of our acting out and our bad habits and of our habitual, problemantic behaviors, not the devil. According to her, imagine the Inner Child as being five years old, the sourc eof our emotional needs. Anderson suggests that the Outer Child is more like 10 - 13 years old, the source of inappropriate acting-out behavior. Your Outer Child is the embodiment of your defense mechanisms. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 223 - Countdown to Coherence: A Scientific Theory of Everything
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Hazel Courteney. She is a columnist for "London Sunday Times" and author. She will talk about her examination of our Universe as nothing but a hologram, projected by an ancient supercomputer or super-mind, and that we are biological computers operating inside a pre-programmed simulator. Courteney considers evidence that other civilizations exist alongside ours in other space/time dimensions; explores the phenomenon of Orbs, and what happened before the Big Bang. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 222 - The Iron Butterfly: Master of Korean Martial Arts
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of Women's History Month in March, Beyond 50 will interview Choon-Ok Jade Harmon and co-writer, Ana Maria Rodriguez. Choon-Ok is the highest ranking woman in Kuk Sool Won with a ninth-degree black belt, the first woman to reach that level. Harmon was born into a poverty-stricken South Korean family. Struggling to survive after the Korean War, she pursued her goals of becoming a martial artist, obtaining an education and coming to the United States where her visions of success and economic independence became a reality. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Employment" talks, listen to an interview with Garrett Miller, author "Hire on a Whim: Four Qualities That Make for Great Employees." item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: If you have tried visualization, affirmation, willpower and positive thinking, but hasn't worked enough to make profound changes, you may have to adjust your core beliefs on a subconscious level. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Joan Cameron. item.title: EPISODE 211 - Dr. Paul Herscu: Learning & Reading Solutions
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Education" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Paul Herscu. He is the founder of the Learning and Reading program to address an alarming statistic: almost 40% of children are not at their expected level of learning, which indicates that many traditional programs have not been effective. His method involves exercises to permanently correct the underlying medical problem other programs fail to address. You can correct basic to learning disabilities, or students who do well, but want better grades. Dr. Herscu has over 20 years of proven success. item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com

item.title: EPISODE 208 - Living with Bad Credit
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Over 110 million Americans have bad credit - almost 50% of the population. For Beyond 50's "Personal Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Geoff Williams. He will offer tips on how to embrace, even benefit from a low credit score. They give lots of invaluable advice for dealing with "lifestyle" events such as how to buy a car, house, or even qualify for a credit card with bad credit.

item.title: EPISODE 202 - How to Safely Quit Anti-Depressants
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: According to the Center for Disease Control (CDC), antidepressants are the drugs most prescribed by doctors and hospitals in the United States - with more than 118 million prescriptions written per year. Many people believe the myth that once you begin taking antidepressants, you have to take them for life. For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Michael Banov. He'll explain about how to taper down from high doses of antidepressants in a safe and effective way, especially if you suffer from a chronic form of depression. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 201 - Raising Eyebrows: A Failed Entrepreneur Finally Gets It Right
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business" talks, listen to an interview with Dal LaMagna. He is the founder of Tweezerman, a socially responsible global beauty tools company that was started with $500 in cash. He'll talk about his funny and poignant business story that is an inspiration to many. LaMagna believes that it's a myth to need large loans or angel investors to get a micro-business going. In fact, he recommends against these. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 200 - Healing Words for Family Reunions
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Family relationships are fraught with danger and frustration., as well as love and connection. Relating with family is important, but it can be challenging. Communication skills are missing in many families. To make matters worse, families are filled with old stories of who people are and the terrible things they have done to each other. Many people continue throughout their lives to related to family members the way they did when they were children. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with David Cunningham of Landmark Education. You'll learn how to let go of the old hurts and have a clean relationship with family members; learn three responses to hearing painful statements from family members; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.itunes:summary: Family relationships are fraught with danger and frustration., as well as love and connection. Relating with family is important, but it can be challenging. Many people continue throughout their lives to related to family members the way they did when they were children. item.title: EPISODE 198 - Healing from Relationship Trauma Without a Therapist
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Eric Wolterstorff of the Love and Trauma Center. He will explain some secrets of trauma psychotherapy: we store traumatic experiences through three different kinds of memory, as if we were using three separate brains. You'll learn about how each kind of memory is healed in a different way...and much healing can be done on your own and with the help of a trained psychotherapist. His book, "Love and Trauma" will teach you how and be available in bookstores in 2012. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 193 - Nik Fackler, Director of "Lovely Still"
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Film" talks, listen to an interview with Nik Fackler, 25, director of "Lovely Still" that stars actors Martin Landau and Ellen Burstyn in a romance that is complicated by Alzheimer's. Fackler began writing and directing short films during high school in Omaha, Nebraska. His work as a painter and filmmaker was quickly recognized by members of Omaha's acclaimed music scene, and before long he was directing music videos and stage backing videos for bands such as Bright Eyes, Cursive, Tilly and the Wall, Sia, The Elected and many others. He chose never to attend college, deciding instead to continue writing and shooting music videos in Omaha, all while searching for support for his first feature-length screenplay. The heartfelt narrative - which would become "Lovely Still" - combined a genuine warmth and surprising maturity that enthralled some of the film industry's most impressive actors and craftsmen. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 192 - Understanding Male & Female Menopause
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talk, listen to an interview with Jim Paoletti, RPh of ZRT Lab in Beaverton, Oregon. Learn about female menopause, and the recently widely debated in the media, male menopause (called Andropause). He will cover the common symptoms experienced by women and men as their hormonal balance changes. Jim will also answer such frequently asked questions as: How can we find out if we have a hormonal imbalance? Does male menopause exist? What are the treatment options? Which treatments are safe? Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 191 - The Conscious Parent
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Many parents are unconsciously passing on an inheritance of psychological pain and emotional void-ness. The children are paying too heavy a price for this lack of consciousness. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, Dr. Shefali Tsabary, Ph.D. believes that time has come to shirt the entire paradigm of parenting on its head. She turns it around to not allow for any such safe illusion of allowing the parent to focus on the child. Instead, her message is that children can be raised into conscious adults only when the parents have allowed themselves to be raised into a higher state of consciousness. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 189 - Reset: Iran, Turkey & America's Future
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Written by foreign correspondent Stephen Kinzer, he argues that two countries in the region are America's logical partners in the 21st century: Iran and Turkey. Kinzer bases his new "Power Triangle" on the similarities between the countries. They share strategic interests, like a stable Iraq, stable Afghanistan, and stable Pakistan, and their people share a desire for democratic values. He recommends that the U.S. reshape relations with its two, traditional Middle East allies: Israel and Saudi Arabia. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: The One Straw Revolution
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Larry Korn, who has helped to advance permaculture design. His work involved translating the writings of Masanobu Fukuoka, a Japanese farmer and philosopher who wrote "One Straw Revolution." His unique farming technique requires no machines, no chemicals and very little weeding. Even though the methods require less labor, you can still have high yields. Tune in to learn how you can do this for your own garden. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 187 - iConnected Parent
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Parents of previous generations had to "let go" when their kids left home, but with current technology, parent don't have to, and most students don't want them to. As a result, the long and winding road to adulthood keeps getting longer, with many students incapable of handling their responsibilities independently. For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Abigail Sullivan Moore. She'll explain about what is an iConnected Parent - when it's good and when it's detrimental; how all this contact can delay kid's ability to grow up; how frequent cell phone usage can make parents and kids more anxious; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Can you really communicate with the "pests" in your garden? Ellen Vande Visse believes that you can! item.title: EPISODE 183 - The Complete Dream Book of Love & Relationships
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Your Dreams Matter! Your dreams are a powerful source of intuitive information about your relationships: paying attention to them can make you smarter, safer and even happier. For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, find out why you dream of an old flame; why so many dreams are tense or scary; and how to understand the core message of any dream. Gillian Holloway is a trusted expert in dream research, having amassed a database of 30,000 case studies. Learn why your dreams matter, how to understand them quickly, and accurately to zero in on your own happiness! Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 182 - Urban Permaculture: Simple Steps Towards Sustainability
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: With the word sustainability floating everywhere, when was the last time you thought about what sustainable living really means? How can you distinguish between marketing "greenwashing" and real solutions that make a difference in your life and to the health of the planet? For Beyond 50's "Green & Sustainable" talks, join Laura Sweany from Terra Flora Farm in Seattle as she offers positive, easy ideas for simple living that are derived from Permaculture philosophy. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 181 - The U.S. Constitution: How Important Is It?
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In no country is the Constitution so respected and revered and disregarded as in the United States. Many Americans, encouraged by public figures such as Sarah Palin, Rush Limbaugh and Ron Paul believe that a major solution to our nation's ills is to restore the "constitutional republic" and return this country to its constitutional principles. For Beyond 50's "Political" talks, listen to an interview with historian, Mark Weber. He will tackle such questions as these: What do those who call for a "constitutional republic" really want? How realistic is this goal? Just what would a return to constitutional principles mean? How important is a constitution in defining a society? Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 178 - Glendi Cultural Food Festival (in Oregon)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Local Events" talks, listen to an interview with Patrice Kuchulis to talk about a family-friendly event called the Glendi Cultural Food Festival that is held annually in Beaverton, OR. "Glendi" is Greek for "Celebration." It's a celebration of ethnic cultures from around the world. They will share their heritages (Greek, Middle Eastern, Russian and Ethiopian), music, traditions, customs and culinary skills. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 169 - The Myth of Stress
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Andrew Bernstein. He'll explain that the way we think about stress and more importantly, how we deal with it, is completely wrong. We generally believe that negative emotions come from what's going on in our lives. In reality, these emotions come from our thoughts about what's going in our lives. Stress management tools like exercise and relaxation don't affect these thoughts, so the stress keeps coming back. But when you learn how to shift your underlying thoughts directly, you can stop managing your stress and start eliminating it. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 164 - Nuclear Energy & Billion-Dollar Cleanup of Hanford
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly" talks, listen to an interview with Ken Niles. He will discuss about the cleanup of Hanford, a nuclear site in Washington state that was used from 1944 to 1988 to produce plutonium for America's nuclear weapons program. He estimates that the cleanup could take 60 years with risks involved. You'll also learn about similar issues at other nuclear sites nationwide. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 162 - 1,000 Awesome Things
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Neil Pasricha. His popular blog celebrates the simple things in life that are awesome: the smell of gasoline, thinking it's Thursday when it's really Friday, or wearing underwear just out of the dryer. A self-described "average guy" with a typical 9-to-5 job in the suburbs, Pasricha started his blog as a small reminder of the free, easy little joys that make life sweet. Today, his site gets over 10 million readers worldwide. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 160 - Floranium & The Secret Life of Plants
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: In celebration of Earth Day, listen to an interview with Martin Heine, founder of the Floranium. Like a mood lamp, it is an innovative technology using highly sensitive electrodes (similar to an EKG machine) that shows various light changes by your plant in response to touch, weather changes, water and more. The technology is based on the revealing research by Clive Backster's plant experiments and the book called "The Secret Life of Plants." Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 159: Oil Pulling for Healthier Teeth & Gums
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Bruce Fife. You can now say "good-bye" to tooth decay, gum disease, bad breath, loose teeth, and bleeding and receding gums. Learn from Dr. Fife about an alternative method of tooth and gum care called oil pulling. By using just a spoonful of virgin coconut oil, you can clean your teeth and have pink gums more thoroughly than regular brushing, flossing and gargling. There's also no toxic side effects. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: Arbordoun: Abundantly Herbal Skin Care
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Skin Care" talks, listen to an interview with Susan of Arbordoun to talk about her organic, herbal skin care products that are hand-picked and processed on Lopez Island, an herbal farm in Northern Washington. The Calendula Cream's rich, herbal emulsion is excellent for dry skin conditions, aging skin, diaper rash and certain eczema, as well as for sunburn. Their other product, Silky Day Lotion, was created with shea butter and herbal extracts, formulated to support and balance for the healthy functioning of the skin. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: The Three-Legged Stool: Tax-Efficient Retirement Planning
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Finance" talks, listen to Rick Rodgers, one the country's top wealth managers. He'll explain about the IRS looking forward to your retirement. Due to our complicated tax system, the government is entitled to a significant amount of your retirement assets - unless you protect them properly. You'll learn about his Three-Legged Stool approach, involving Leg One: Tax-Deferred Savings Strategies; Leg Two: After-Tax Strategies; and Leg Three: Tax Free Savings Strategies. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Sheryl Leventhal. She'll talk about "Rethinking Cancer," a documentary that presents a compelling look into the therapeutic and psychological journeys of five men and women who chose to use non-toxic, bio-repair therapies to overcome serious illness. item.title: EPISODE 154 - Losing Weight in Midlife with the HCG Hormone
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Sharon Korter, owner and clinical director of MediPro Slim. She'll explain about a proven way to lose pounds, especially as it gets more difficult in midlife, by taking the hormone called HCG (human chorionic gonadotropin) under medical supervision. It's safe and effective. You'll learn about the science behind it and stories of success. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 153 - Women, Witches & Weeds
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks to celebrate Women's History Month, listen to an interview with Master Herbalist, Susun Weed. She will talk about the European tradition of women healers regarded as witches that were burned, along with their infants by the Jesuits. They then moved to the New World to follow a mandate to kill every medicine woman and man among the Native people. American women today of all ages are reclaiming their power and re-envisioning themselves. They are once again honoring their ability to heal, simply with the gifts of the Earth and the gifts of the Grandmothers. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 152 - Millionaire Babies or Bankrupt Brats? Part 2
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Kristan Leatherman from the Love and Logic Institute. She offers her best solutions to teaching kids how to solve their own problems, while gaining the confidence and capability they need to meet life's financial challenges. And parents benefit because they establish healthy control now, without resorting to anger or threats, and without the guilt of having to rescue their kids later when they should be financially independent. This is Part 2 of 2 interviews. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 151 - Live Your Bliss
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to an interview with Terry Cole-Whittaker. She'll explain that our birthright is to follow and fully embrace our personal bliss. Terry challenges us to recognize the messages we've absorbed - from family, school, and culture - about how we should be, and then to reclaim our true natures. In doing so, we tap into our innate powers and begin living the life we were born to live. It's all about bliss and pleasure, not about sets of rules and regulations. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: Dangerous Patterns in American Foreign Policy
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Historian Mark Weber. He'll take a look at the vast and enduring US military role in the world, reviewing the record of American intervention around the globe for more than a century. You'll also learn about the pretexts used by political leaders to justify the campaigns - in the Spanish-American war of 1898, our first "imperial outreach, as well as in World War I, World War II, the Vietnam War, and most recently in Iraq and Afghanistan. He'll show how this pattern is rooted in the American national character. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

She offers her best solutions to teaching kids how to solve their own problems, while gaining the confidence and capability they need to meet life's financial challenges. And parents benefit because they establish healthy control now, without resorting to anger or threats, and without the guilt of having to rescue their kids later when they should be financially independent. This is Part 1 of 2 interviews. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: The 24-Hour Diet
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with bestselling author, Professor Brian Peskin.According to him, everything you've learned about nutrition is all wrong! He busts the most common nutritional myths and corrects them with the latest research findings. He is the world's most trusted authority on health and nutrition. Through his book, "The 24-Hour Diet", you'll learn about the most ideal way to eat well and the science behind it that's never been revealed before to the general public. Peskin is also the author of "The Hidden Story of Cancer" about oxygen deficiency on a cellular level as the primary cause of cancer. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 142 - Anastasia: The Energy of Life (Book 7)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The true story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversations with her. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed many worldwide. For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainability" talks, listen to publisher and literary translator Dr. Leonid Sharashkin about Book 7, called "The Energy of Life," where you'll find out about the forgotten pages of humanity's history, on religion, on the roots of inter-racial and inter-religious conflict â?? and even on what constitutes ideal nutrition. Anastasia also reveals that a new way of thinking â?? together with a lifestyle in harmony with Nature â?? can lead to true happiness. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Gary Reiswig, an Alzheimer's activist. item.title: EPISODE 139 - One Straw Revolution
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Larry Korn, who has helped to advance permaculture design. His work involved translating the writings of Masanobu Fukuoka, a Janapnese farmer and philosopher who wrote "One Straw Revolution." His unique farming technique requires no machines, no chemicals and very little weeding. Even though the methods require less labor, you can still have high yields. Tune in to learn how you can do this for your own garden. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 138 - Testing & Natural Treatment of Thyroid Disorders
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to an interview with Dr. Allison McAllister, a naturopathic physician and clinical consultant with ZRT Laboratory in Oregon. She will talk about Hypothyroidism and Hyperthyroidism that is a common condition where they thyroid gland is either "overactive" or "underactive" in its secretion of the thyroid hormone in the bloodstream. You'll learn about the symptoms, medical tests available and the natural treatment of thyroid dysfunction. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 133 - Anastasia: Next of Kin (Book 6)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The true story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversations with her. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed many worldwide. For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainability" talks, listen to publisher and literary translator Dr. Leonid Sharashkin about Book 6, called "The Book of Kin," where you'll meet the author's son - raised naturally in the forest by his mother, Anastasia. This young boy's profound intelligence forces Megre to take a totally fresh look at education, science, history and more. You'll also learn about humanity's shocking history that has been distorted and kept secret for thousands of years. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 130 - The Lives of Stars & Lunar Water Findings
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: We've had him as a guest several times before. For Beyond 50's "Science" talks, listen to an interview with Ken Croswell, a Harvard-trained astronomer. He'll take you on a tour of the stars - the young, the living, the aging and the dead. Learn about the discovery of a bizarre planet that orbits its star backwards; a star near the sun (13 light years away) that seems to have come from another galaxy; extra-terrestrial life on other planets; the latest findings from NASA after dropping a spent rocket rocket motor on a crater earlier in search for lunar water; and more. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 129 - How to Be an Everyday Philanthropist
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices," listen to an interview with Nicole Bouchard Boles. She offers many ideas on how to make a difference in your home, community and world at no cost. As an example, turn your pet into a "volunteer." item.title: The Hidden Story of Cancer
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Professor Brian Peskin, author of "The Hidden Story of Cancer." He'll explain that the cure for cancer was found back in the 1920's by Nobel Prize winner Otto Warburg. Professor Peskin takes Warburg's teachings to a higher level on how to oxygenate the cells naturally to treat the primary (not secondary) cause of cancer. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 127 - Death Passages: A New Perspective on Death & Dying
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Spirituality" talks, listen to an interview with Clairvoyant, Sonja Grace. She will talk about what it's like crossing over to the "other side" to give a new perspective on the process of death and dying. According to Sonja, death is just the beginning. Too many are so attached to the physical body and physical realm that they have trouble letting go. She will include stories of communicating with the dead and what the other planes of existence where the spirits reside is like. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 126 - Oregon's Wild Harvest: Growing Herbs Biodynamically
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainable Practices" talks, listen to an interview with Randal Buresh of Oregon's Wild Harvest. He will explain about a unique way of growing herbs that is done biodynamically: a form of organic farming that emphaiszes manure and composts, along with fermented herbal and mineral preparations and the use of an astronomical sowing and planting calendar. Biodynamic farming was developed by Rudolph Steiner, founder of the spiritual philosophy called Anthroposophy. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 123 - Blitzed by Menopause
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Medical Care" talks, listen to Jan Brehm of Planet Sweet Pea about a video she produced with her husband called "Blitzed by Menopause." It's both funny and educational - made for men to understand their partner's menopausal experiences that can be a source of conflict in a marriage. You'll enjoy the mix of good acting, using spoofs and parodies; a medical talk by a naturopath; and a real-life coaching session with couples challenged by menopause in the end. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: How to Grow a Giant & Organic Garden
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Gardening" talks, listen to an interview with Roland Evans. He is part of a long line of family gardeners from Ireland, going back to the 1890s. His brother John is famous for earning 9 Guiness Book of World Records for growing the largest vegetables. According to him, the secret is in the soil. He will talk about how to prepare your Fall plantings for growing them organic and extra big through revitalizing the soil using a compost tea of lots of micro-organisms. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 121 - Elder Rage...Take My Father Please!
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Did you know that one in three people will be affected by some type of dementia - either in themselves or a loved one. By age 65, one out of eight is afflicted by Alzheimer's and by 85, nearly one in every two. For Beyond 50's "Caregiving" talks, listen to an interview with Jacqueline Marcell, author of "Elder Rage" about the difference between normal aging and early signs of dementia, along with creative, behavioral techniques for managing the condition. About 78 million Boomers are facing the careigiving years with their parents, yet most are unprepared emotionally, legally and financially. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 119 - T5T: Tibetan Five Rejuvenation Rites Exercises
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Fitness" talks, listen to an interview with Carolinda Witt from Australia. She will explain about an ancient set of exercises from Tibet called T5T that can dramatically slow down aging and prevent illness. It is done through specific yoga postures, "energetic breathing," and spinning the body to spin all of the chakras (seven energy centers on the body) at the same rate. When the spin rate is slowed or blocked, the vital life force energy cannon circulate and illness and aging set in. Many worldwide have experienced remarkable results from practicing T5T for a few minutes daily. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 117 - When Technology Fails, Part 3
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Practices," listen to Matthew Stein who wrote "When Technology Fails" about essential survival skills. He believes that we will see increasing environmental and political instabilities that will cause disruptions in the flow of electricity and goods to large numbers of people. He wrote the Bible on sustainable living skills to survive a long emergency. You'll learn things like peak oil, water quality and treatment, low-tech medicine, generating heat and power, and more. It's essential to get his book, just in case. This interview is the third in a series with Matthew Stein. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The true story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversations with her. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed many worldwide. For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainability" talks, listen to publisher and literary translator Dr. Leonid Sharashkin about Book 5, called "Who Are We?" that reveals Anastasia's vision for the future. She paints images of exquisite beauty, abundance, peace and harmony. Anastasia will inspire you to begin creating a different life for yourself - one far better than anything you might have previously imagined. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 108 - "Green" Funeral & Burial, An Alternative
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Death & Dying" talks, listen to an interview about joining the Home Funeral Movement. There is a growing interest by many to bypass the expensive funeral industry to exercise their individual "rights" to care for their own at death. Instead of handing over a loved one's body to a mortician for embalming and display before cremation or burial, another alternative is individualized funeral rites (based on culture and beliefs) and eco-friendly burials. Crossings is a leading resource on family directed after-life care. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: When Technology Fails: Low Tech Medicine for Emergencies
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Practices," listen to Matthew Stein who wrote "When Technology Fails" about essential survival skills. He believes that we will see increasing environmental and political instabilities that will cause disruptions in the flow of electricity and goods to large numbers of people. He wrote the Bible on sustainable living skills to survive a long emergency. You'll learn things like peak oil, water quality and treatment, low-tech medicine, generating heat and power, and more. It's essential to get his book, just in case. This interview is part of a series with Matthew Stein to know how to create your own self-reliant, low-tech home pharmacy when there is no doctor for a long term emergency. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 104 - Jeannie Ralston, "The Unlikely Lavender Queen"
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Growth" talks, listen to Jeannie Ralston. In 1990, she was a successful magazine writer and bona fide city girl. She shares her intimate story of giving up a lot for the man she loves to live in rural Texas, converting a dilapidated barn into a livable home, deal with scorpions, the unbearably hot summers, and raise two young children. When her husband Robb returns from a trip to Provence with a plan for growing lavender on their land, she slowly falls in love with lavender, creating a thriving lifestyle around it, and discovering a new side to herself. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 93 - Annette Sym: Lessons from Australia's Weight Loss Guru
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Cooking with Love" and "Business Basics" talks, we've brought back Annette Sym, Australia's leading cookbook author on losing weight. She recently introduced the American version of her cookbook "Symply Too Good to Be True" that is packed with low-fat recipes. You'll learn about her transformational weight loss and how she has maintained her sleek look for almost 20 years. Even Oprah couldn't do that. Afterwards, Annette will discuss about the humble beginnings of her business, using an ironing board as a desk and having trouble getting a business loan to later growing it into a multi-million dollar empire. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 92 - Trackers NW: Buffalo Butchering & Meat Preservation
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Practices," listen to an interview with Andrew Pinger of Trackers NW in Oregon. He'll talk about the class he teaches to address our general disconect with our food through full, unabridged participation in the killing, gutting, skinning, butchering and eating of a domestic American Buffalo. item.title: EPISODE 90 - When Technology Fails: An Introduction
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Practices," listen to Matthew Stein who wrote "When Technology Fails" about essential survival skills. He believes that we will see increasing environmental and political instabilities that will cause disruptions in the flow of electricity and goods to large numbers of people. He wrote the Bible on sustainable living skills to survive a long emergency. You'll learn things like peak oil, water quality and treatment, low-tech medicine, generating heat and power, and more. It's essential to get his book, just in case. This interview is the first in a 3-part series with Matthew Stein. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 81 - Anastasia: The Space of Love (Book 3)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The true story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversations with her. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed millions of lives. For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainability" talks, listen to publisher and literary translator Dr. Leonid Sharashkin about Book 3. You'll get a behind-the-scenes understanding about the armed men with machine guns who got a taste of hell from Anastasia after trying to capture her; raising Vladamir's baby boy with the help of animals; and a school within the forest attended by 7 to 17-year-olds who are mostly self-taught with hardly any adult supervision. They can complete a 10-year math syllabus in one year, while learning three foreign languages, martial arts and ballroom dancing. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 75 - Dr. Gabriel Cousens: Reversing Diabetes & Tree of Life Center
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: About 25% of Americans over the age of 60 have type 2 diabetes - a condition many believe to be irreversible. Gabriel Cousens, MD, the founder of the Tree of Life Rejuvenation Center offers a 21-Day Reversing Diabetes Naturally Program that is medically supervised and can have lasting results. Imagine the freedom of no longer living with the disease. Located within a majestic valley of Arizona, you'll be supported by the Tree of Life staff to reset your cellular memory; learn holistic skills from the kitchen to the living room, to the garden. The Tree of Life empowers you to become a "Sage of Age". They have repeatedly seen beautiful reactivations within the over-50 group. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business Basics" talks, listen to an interview with Ann Sieg. She learned from hard experience from being in many network marketing businesses that that you are not taught how to really run your business successfully. Most programs offered by a company teach an outdated model that has lead to a high attrition rate, especially in the first year. Ann will explain about the lies "being fed to you" and how to use better methods of lead generation and duplication of your efforts to earn high commissions. Her system has helped many who are in an MLM, affiliate program, and even traditional businesses. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 67 - Movie Speak: How to Talk Like You Belong on a Movie Set
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Entertainment" talks, listen to an interview with Tony Bill, the Oscar-winning producer of "The Sting" and other box office successes. He'll explain about how the process of film making in Hollywood has been passed on by oral tradition for more than 100 years. The language of moviemaking is the only way of communicating on a set and is all but unknown to the outside world. He'll reveal some of the secret language and explain what it's like to be a film producer, director, actor and crew member. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 63 - FlexNow: Medical Breakthrough in Natural Joint Health
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Until now, the cause of Osteoarthritis has been unknown until recently from medical research done in Australia. For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to an interview with Len Smith, CEO/President of BSP Pharma Inc., about their remarkable product called FlexNow that contains shea nut from West Africa. The nut is known to have the highest concentration of inflammation fighters called triterpenes - leading to a dramatic reduction in the breakdown of collagen, which makes up 70% of cartilage and significantly reduces the pain. Taking glucosamine is not enough. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 62 - Anastasia: The Ringing Cedars of Russia (Book 2)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The true story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversation with Anastasia. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed millions of lives. For Beyond 50's "Eco-Friendly & Sustainability" talks, listen to publisher and literary translator Dr. Leonid Sharashkin about Book 2. You'll get a behind-the-scenes understanding about how the series of books came to be published through a series of remarkable incidents experienced by Vladimir; the healing power of the ringing cedar trees; and meeting his new son cared for by Anastasia. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Legal" talks, listen to an interview with Philip K. Howard to point out how America's ever-increasing legalistic culture is threatening our daily lives. He outlines that our culture wastes time and billions of dollars on obsessive defensiveness while denying us the ability and the freedom to make the choices we need to run our society. item.title: EPISODE 60 - How to Safely Remove Heavy Metal Toxicity in the Body
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, Dr. Alan Greenberg of Chelorex is back to talk about how he came up with a formula to naturally remove heavy metal toxicity from the body. He warns about the harmful effects of heavy metal poisoning (like mercury) that's found in foods, crown fillings, vaccinations, water and air. Many products on the market are either non-effective or partially effective, which includes liquid zeolite, synthetic chelators like EDTA, and others. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 59 - For the Insured: Having Higher Liability Rates is Important!
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to an interview with Josie Planton of Farmers Insurance in Oregon City, OR. about the importance of getting the right amount of insurance coverage and adjusting it to major life changes. As she explains, the second person most people call on for an emergency after 911 is their insurance agent. Her talk is a reminder to not make any expensive mistakes that can cost you dearly if you're not insured properly. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 57 - The Cannery Pier Hotel/Fisher Poets Gathering
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "History" talks, listen to an interview with Robert Jacob, the designer of the Cannery Pier Hotel in Astoria, Oregon about his hotel's historical ties to the fishing industry that goes back about 100 years. The city was once considered "The Cannery Capital of the World." Afterwards, Jennifer Winston will go over her award-winning film, "Fisher Poets" - a documentary on the annual gathering of seafarers in Astoria. They come from all over the country to share their love of fishing through storytelling, song, poetry and music. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 56 - "Contagious," a Techno-Thriller
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: If you're a Michael Crichton or Stephen King fan, then you'll love to hear from Scott Sigler, the author of "Contagious". It's rare that you'll read a techno-thriller that is backed up by lots of hard science, like in this story about a mysterious disease sweeping across America that transforms ordinary people into violent, paranoid murderers. The only explanation: the epidemic is driven not by evolution, but by some unknown intelligence. The story's best weapon is a former football star named Perry Dawsey. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 55 - A Journal for Jordan
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: This is about our soldiers in Iraq unlike any other. Before falling into battle, a soldier named First Sergeant Charles Monroe King wrote a journal about life lessons for his unborn son, Jordan, in case he did not make it home from Iraq. King, 48, was killed on Oct. 14, 2006. His son, Jordan, was seven months old. Within the pages are wrenching accounts of losing men in battle and with advice on everything from withstanding disappointment to behaving on a date. For Beyond 50's "Parenting" talks, listen to an interview with Dana Canedy, (who was married to King) about the journal that will be made into a movie by famous actor Denzel Washington. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 53 - Carol Gardner & Zelda, the Supermodel Dog
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Personal Transformation" talks, listen to an interview with Carol Gardner, a true underdog. A divorce at 52 left her with no income and a huge debt. She followed the advice of her divorce attorney to get a dog for a companion - an English bulldog she named Zelda. Carol turned her life dramatically around by using her background as a creative director in advertising to design one of the most successful line of greeting cards called "Zelda Wisdom" for Hallmark. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 52 - Scratch Beginnings: Me, $25, and the American Dream
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Adam Shepard graduated from college in the summer of 2006 feeling disillusioned by the apathy he saw around him. Eager to see if he could make something out of nothing, he set out to prove wrong the theory that those who start at the bottom stay at the bottom, and to see if the American Dream can still be a reality. Carrying only a sleeping bag, the clothes on his back and $25 in cash, his goal was to have, after a year, $2,500, a working car, and a furnished apartment. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
item.itunes:keywords: Baby Boomers, Beyond 50, Mid-Life, Portland, Oregon, Pacific Northwest, Empty Nesters, Sandwich Generation, After 50, Mature Lifestyle, Healthy Aging, Hippies, Educational Program.

item.title: EPISODE 49 - Jill Bolte Taylor: My Stroke of Insight
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Considered one of the most influential women in America, Harvard trained nueroanatomist Dr. Taylor will be on Beyond 50 to talk about what it's like to have a stroke, based on when she had a severe hemorrhage in the left hemisphere of her brain in 1996. It took her years to recover. Without the use of part of her brain's circuitry, her consciousness shifted to experience being "at one with the universe" and will explain about the necessity of developing inner peace for your health and humanity's sake. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 47 - Anastasia: The Ringing Cedars Series (Book 1)
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: The story of Anastasia from the Russian taiga forests of Siberia is a remarkable one. Written by Vladimir Megre, he discovered Anastasia in 1995 and wrote about her story from many conversation with Anastasia. She was born in the forest in 1969 to parents who died tragically when she was a baby. Raised and cared for by animals in the wild, Anastasia learned to live peacefully and in harmony with Nature. Her message to the world has touched and changed millions of lives. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Political" talks, listen to an interview with Adrew Bacevich, the author of "Limits of Power". He'll explain about how the U.S. has embarked on a disastrous career of empire building and military adventurism that is bankrupting and corrupting the country. A U.S.-run world of easy credit, abundant oil, and cheap consumer goods is not sustainable. The grand strategy, he believes, is the idea of containment. item.title: EPISODE 20 - Dealing with Elder Rage
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: Are you at your wit's end with an elderly and loved one who makes unreasonable demands of your time? Has the person become depressed, manipulative, distrustful or hostile? If this sounds familiar, then listen to Jacqueline Marcell on Beyond 50 talk about her own experiences of what a caregiving nightmare it was to deal with her difficult parents and offers her best suggestions on what you can do to cope. item.title: EPISODE 19 - Seven Bold Ways to Revitalize Democracy
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's political talks, listen to Michael Waldman, the former speechwriter for President Bill Clinton and avid historian. He offers common sense ideas that are his seven bold ways to revitalize democracy. Some of them include ending voter registration, end partisan gerrymandering, end the Electoral College and more. It's a call to restore the vision of the Founding Fathers, where people run the government and the government serves the people. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.title: EPISODE 18 - Starting Your First Business in Midlife
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Business Basics" talks, listen to Jeff Williams, the founder of Bizstarters.com. He talks about the growing trend of 50+ Boomers coming full circle to become adult entrepreneurs. Most have turned to corporate employment as adults in order to fulfill their financial obligations. And now, as millions of older Boomers reach and pass age 60, they are taking a long look at being their own boss. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "World Travel" talks, listen to Rosemary Mahoney talk about going solo and in disguise as a man to rowboat down the Nile. Visit www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.

item.itunes:summary: For Beyond 50's "Finance" talks, listen to Jeff Opdyke, a Wall Street Journal reporter, encourage you to invest globally, especially when America's economy is suffering. While America has 10,000 public companies, there are 4X that number outside our country. They aren't as different as you imagine. For more, visit http://www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
item.itunes:keywords: Baby Boomers, Beyond 50, Mid-Life, Portland, Oregon, Pacific Northwest, Empty Nesters, Sandwich Generation, After 50, Mature Lifestyle, Healthy Aging, Hippies, Educational Program.

item.title: EPISODE 1 - Anand Rajendran: The Healing Power of the Breath
item.author: daniel@beyond50radio.com
item.description: For Beyond 50's "Natural Healing" talks, listen to Anand Rajendran, a former software engineer turned full-time seminar teacher for the Art of Living. He has taught over 300,000 people worldwide about the power of the breath for self-healing. Learn from him about how breathing techniques can help you achieve a peaceful and calm mind. For more, visit http://www.Beyond50Radio.com and sign up for our free e-newsletter.
